hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 20-day realized volatility falls below its 60-day realized volatility by 15% or more during a NEUTRAL regime, a volatility expansion event will occur within 5 trading days, with BTC price moving >3% in either direction from the breakout level.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression in neutral markets often precedes significant directional moves as pent-up energy releases. The 15% threshold filters for meaningful compression events.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < BTC 60-day realized volatility * 0.85
BTC price has traded in <2.5% range for 3 consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves >3% from entry in either direction
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility remains compressed for 7 days without expansion

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of signals result in false breakouts (price returns to compression range within 24 hours of initial move)
